title: 103_hr3810
content: The Act titled "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" is referred to as the short title. Eligibility criteria are outlined in Section 2. Section 2 of the Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994 expands eligibility criteria for acquiring lands, easements, and rights-of-ways necessary for construction of treatment works. It also includes provisions for rural nonprofit water associations to provide wastewater treatment and water supply services to communities. SEC. 3. CAPITALIZATION GRANT AGREEMENTS. Amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to encourage the use of innovative technologies in construction of treatment works. Loan Program under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans to rural and disadvantaged communities at or below market interest rates, including interest free and negative-interest loans, with terms not exceeding 40 years or the project's useful life. The Loan Program under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans to rural and disadvantaged communities at or below market interest rates, with terms not exceeding 40 years or the project's useful life, and not to exceed 15 percent of all loans made from the water pollution control revolving fund. The Loan Program under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans to rural and disadvantaged communities at or below market interest rates, with terms not exceeding 40 years or the project's useful life. Additionally, not more than 15 percent of all loans made from the water pollution control revolving fund will be used to make negative-interest loans to these communities. Amendments also include providing planning grants to disadvantaged communities. The Loan Program under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans to rural and disadvantaged communities at or below market interest rates, with terms not exceeding 40 years or the project's useful life. Additionally, grants will be provided to rural and disadvantaged communities to cover up to 75 percent of planning and predevelopment costs for construction or improvement of treatment works. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to provide loans and grants to rural and disadvantaged communities for water pollution control projects. Grants shall not be less than 1 percent or exceed 2 percent of Federal grant awards, with a maximum of $75,000 per project. Definitions for "rural and disadvantaged communities" are also provided. The term "rural and disadvantaged communities" refers to a service area of a publicly owned treatment works defined by the State, excluding areas with a population of 10,000 or more and residents with a household income above 75% of the national median. A "negative-interest loan" is a loan provided by a State for water pollution projects. A negative-interest loan is a zero percent interest loan provided by a State to rural and disadvantaged communities for water pollution projects. The State forgives up to 2 percent of the loan principal per year, not exceeding a total forgiveness of 20 percent over the loan term. SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS amended to limit costs to 4 percent of total funds deposited into the fund. SEC. 6. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE introduces a grant program for technical assistance. The Administrator may provide grants to organizations for training and technical assistance to rural communities on treatment works. $15,000,000 per fiscal year is authorized for this purpose until 1998. The Administrator may provide grants for training and technical assistance to rural communities on treatment works until 1998. Funds shall remain available until expended. Section 607 of the Act is amended by inserting "(other than section 608)" after "title".
